alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 2:54PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Albany County through 330 PM MDT... At 252 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over The Buttes, or 10 miles south of Laramie, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very heavy rainfall may lead to minor flooding. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laramie, The Buttes, Tie Siding and Hutton Lake. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 318 and 325. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
